channel.title: rock on Loud Legends
channel.description: Recent content in rock on Loud Legends

item.title: Watch: DREAM THEATER Releases 'Night Terror' Video Ahead of 'Parasomnia' Album
item.description: DREAM THEATER announces new album “Parasomnia”, releasing February 7, 2025.

item.title: John 5 Breaks Silence on Relationship With Rob Zombie After Joining Mötley Crüe
item.description: John 5 hasn’t spoken to Rob Zombie since leaving his band to join Mötley Crüe in 2022, though there’s no bad blood.

item.title: Scott Stapp Reflects on Sobriety: "Drinking is No Longer an Option"
item.description: Scott Stapp opens up about maintaining sobriety and creating a sober environment while on tour.

item.title: James Hetfield: "We Don’t Want to Be a Legacy Band That Only Plays Hits"
item.description: James Hetfield states Metallica doesn’t want to become a “legacy band” that only plays greatest hits.

item.title: Korn and Adidas Pay Tribute to 1994 with New Superstar Shoes
item.description: Korn and Adidas release a new Superstar shoe inspired by the band’s 1994 debut album.

item.title: KORN’s Brian 'Head' Welch on Mortality: "I Want to Die in a Bed, Not On Stage"
item.description: Brian “Head” Welch is considering retirement within the next 10 years but insists he won’t fake it if the band starts to sound outdated.

item.title: Study Shows Korn Fans Get the Best Value for Their Tickets
item.description: Korn offers the best value per minute at concerts, with an average cost of 39 cents per minute.

item.title: Korn Showed Us the Ropes, Mötley Crüe Wanted Us Off the Stage, Says Jacoby Shaddix
item.description: Papa Roach had their best tour experiences with Korn in 2000, learning the ropes from them.

item.title: Korn's Hits Get a Lo-Fi Makeover—And They Approve
item.description: Korn approved a lo-fi instrumental cover album of their hits by lonelyboy.

item.title: Brian Welch on Korn's New Album: “The Heaviest in Years”
item.description: Korn’s guitarist Brian “Head” Welch claims the band’s upcoming music will be the heaviest they’ve produced in years.

item.title: Korn's Brian Welch Introduces New Record Label XOVR Records; VIDEO
item.description: Brian “Head” Welch from Korn launches XOVR Records with manager David W.
